intro: Chaetoseris zhenduoi, commonly known as the Tibetan blueweed, is a flowering plant species native to the high-altitude regions of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to extreme climatic conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and blue or purple in color. Chaetoseris zhenduoi plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
